decks.notes: This Modern deck focuses on using Death's Shadow as a powerful threat that can quickly grow in size based on the player's life total. By utilizing cards like Mishra's Bauble, Street Wraith, and Thoughtseize to lower their own life total, the deck aims to play Death's Shadow early and unleash its full potential. The deck also includes a mix of removal spells like Fatal Push and Terminate, as well as disruptive cards like Inquisition of Kozilek and Liliana of the Veil to control the board and protect the Death's Shadow's lethal attacks.

This deck focuses on aggressive plays and quick damage output, utilizing efficient burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Spike to deal damage to the opponent directly. It also includes creatures like Monastery Swiftspear, Goblin Guide, and Eidolon of the Great Revel to apply pressure on the opponent and maintain board presence. The deck aims to quickly deplete the opponent's life total and win the game before they have a chance to stabilize or mount a defense.

This Mardu Aggro deck focuses on fast and efficient plays to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of burn spells, discard effects, and creature tokens. By utilizing cards like Young Pyromancer and Bedlam Reveler, the deck aims to control the board and finish off the opponent quickly with a combination of aggro creatures and direct damage spells. The inclusion of versatile cards like Kolaghan's Command and Lingering Souls allows for flexibility in different matchups, while cards like Thoughtseize and Collective Brutality help disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, this deck aims to be aggressive while maintaining some control over the game.

This deck focuses on putting pressure on the opponent with efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf and Death's Shadow, while disrupting their game plan with discard spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek. The deck aims to lower its own life total to make Death's Shadow a massive threat, while also using cards like Street Wraith to cycle through the deck and find the necessary pieces for victory. The inclusion of cards like Traverse the Ulvenwald and Mishra's Bauble helps to make the deck more consistent and versatile in different situations.

This deck focuses on aggressive play with a tribe-based Human archetype, utilizing cards that disrupt opponents while building up a strong board presence with creatures like Thalia's Lieutenant and Champion of the Parish. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with quick and efficient creature plays, utilizing cards like Aether Vial to cheat creatures onto the battlefield. With a mix of disruption and aggressive creature strategies, this deck can quickly close out games before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

The deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands to generate a large amount of mana in order to control the game. It includes various counterspells, card draw spells, and removal spells to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes powerful win conditions such as Emrakul, the Promised End and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon. By using these cards and the Urza lands efficiently, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and ultimately win the game.

The key concept of this deck is to ramp up mana quickly using Utopia Sprawl and Arbor Elf, while disrupting the opponent's mana base with cards like Blood Moon and Stone Rain. The deck aims to control the game by destroying lands and creatures, while also deploying threats like Tireless Tracker and Stormbreath Dragon to apply pressure. The inclusion of versatile cards like Primal Command and Chandra, Torch of Defiance provides flexibility in different matchups, allowing the deck to adapt to various situations and outmaneuver opponents.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy using a variety of powerful Human creatures. By utilizing cards like Aether Vial and Cavern of Souls to quickly deploy creatures onto the battlefield, combined with disruptive cards like Meddling Mage and Kitesail Freebooter to interfere with opponent's plans, this deck aims to establish a strong board presence early on and maintain pressure throughout the game. With cards like Thalia's Lieutenant and Champion of the Parish boosting the team's power, this deck thrives on synergy and aggression to secure victory.

The key strategy of this deck is to assemble the Urzatron lands (Urza's Tower, Urza's Power Plant, Urza's Mine) to generate massive amounts of mana to cast powerful late-game threats like Wurmcoil Engine, Walking Ballista, and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon. Control the game using counterspells like Condescend and Remand, along with removal spells like Dismember and Oblivion Stone. Use card draw and selection with Thirst for Knowledge and Gifts Ungiven to find key pieces of the combo. The deck aims to outvalue and outlast opponents in long games with powerful threats and control elements.

This deck focuses on assembling the Twin Exarch combo using Kiki-Jiki, Mirror Breaker and Deceiver Exarch to create infinite token copies of Deceiver Exarch. The deck includes control elements such as Remand, Cryptic Command, and Spell Snare to protect the combo pieces while also running disruption like Blood Moon and Lightning Bolt to disrupt opponents. The deck also includes card selection and filtering with cards like Serum Visions and Opt to help find combo pieces quickly. The goal is to assemble the combo and win the game through repeated token generation.

The deck focuses on creating a wide board presence of token creatures with the help of cards like Legion's Landing, Lingering Souls, and Spectral Procession, reinforced by cards like Intangible Virtue to pump up the tokens and make them more threatening. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek to disrupt the opponent's game plan, along with removal spells like Path to Exile and Fatal Push. Sorin, Solemn Visitor provides additional token generation and a powerful anthem effect to further enhance the aggression of the deck.

The deck focuses on generating mana quickly with rituals and cantrips to cast a lethal Grapeshot or Empty the Warrens to win the game. Cards like Gifts Ungiven and Past in Flames help set up combo turns and ensure resources are available. Goblin Electromancer and Baral, Chief of Compliance help reduce the cost of spells and increase efficiency. The deck aims to chain spells together to generate a large storm count, overwhelming the opponent with a flurry of spells and burning them out in one explosive turn.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with a swarm of artifact creatures, supported by cards like Steel Overseer and Cranial Plating to boost their power. The goal is to quickly build a strong board presence and deal damage efficiently to win the game before the opponent can establish their own strategy. The deck's synergy between artifact creatures, equipment, and mana sources allows for explosive early-game plays and aggressive tactics to pressure the opponent.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan by controlling the board with a mix of removal spells and counterspells. It also utilizes card advantage through draw spells like Thought Scour and Ancestral Vision, along with recursion from Snapcaster Mage and Kolaghan's Command. The presence of efficient threats like Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, and delve creatures like Gurmag Angler and Tasigur, the Golden Fang, allows the deck to close out the game quickly once it has stabilized.

This Eldrazi Aggro deck focuses on ramping up quickly with Urza lands and Eldrazi Temple to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures such as Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher. The deck also includes removal spells like Dismember and board wipes like All Is Dust to control the battlefield. Karn Liberated provides additional removal and disruption, while cards like Chalice of the Void can shut down opponent's spells. Overall, the key strategy is to overwhelm opponents with fast, efficient Eldrazi creatures while disrupting their game plan.

This deck focuses on quickly building up a strong board presence with efficient creatures like Knight of the Reliquary and Voice of Resurgence, supported by mana ramp from cards like Noble Hierarch and Birds of Paradise. It also includes utility cards like Collected Company for card advantage and Path to Exile for removal. The land package provides consistency and flexibility with cards like Horizon Canopy and Ghost Quarter. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with aggressive creatures while maintaining control of the battlefield.
